title: Ticket #4769: DAGMan failure because of double event read
description:
(This actually looks more like a library problem than an actual DAGMan problem, but I'm classifying it as a DAGMan problem for now.)

Anyhow, the job_dagman_maxprescripts test is failing (sometimes) on Windows (Windows8, at least). In the case I saw, it failed because we read two submit events for the same job (although the actual log file only has one event). Here's stuff from the dagman.out file. 

  12/10/14 12:26:21 Submitting Condor Node NODE19 job(s)...
  ...
  12/10/14 12:26:22 From submit: Submitting job(s).
  12/10/14 12:26:22 From submit: 1 job(s) submitted to cluster 21.
  12/10/14 12:26:22       assigned Condor ID (21.0.0)
  ...
  12/10/14 12:26:22 Reassigning the id of job NODE19 from (21.0.0) to (21.0.0)
  12/10/14 12:26:22 Event: ULOG_SUBMIT for Condor Node NODE19 (21.0.0)
  12/10/14 12:26:22 Number of idle job procs: 2
  12/10/14 12:26:22 Reassigning the id of job NODE19 from (21.0.0) to (21.0.0)
  12/10/14 12:26:22 Event: ULOG_SUBMIT for Condor Node NODE19 (21.0.0)
  12/10/14 12:26:22 BAD EVENT: job (21.0.0) submitted, submit count != 1 (2)
  12/10/14 12:26:22 Continuing with DAG in spite of bad event (BAD EVENT:
    job (21.0.0) submitted, submit count != 1 (2)) because of
    allow_events setting
  ...
  12/10/14 12:26:32 Error checking Condor job events: BAD EVENT:
    job (21.0.0) ended, submit count != 1 (2)
  12/10/14 12:26:32 ERROR "Assertion ERROR on (false)" at line 3180 in
    file c:\condor\execute\dir_8420\userdir\src\condor_dagman\dag.cpp

I wonder if the fact that DAGMan is writing a lot of POST script terminated events somehow relates to this problem...
attachments:
• job_dagman_maxprescripts.dag.dagman.out 50056 bytes added by wenger on 2014-Dec-11 18:56:29 UTC.
  • job_dagman_maxprescripts.dag.nodes.log 19900 bytes added by wenger on 2014-Dec-11 18:56:41 UTC.
